result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Yakaites

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM1958, 15CM2012, 16CM60 called: 9:36am
State appears by ADA A.Mort.  Def appears in person and with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
15CM2012>>D&RI
16CM60 - Ct. 2 (Retail Theft)>>D&RI
16CM60 - Ct. 4 (Misd BJ)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
16CM60 - Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST
16CM60 - Ct. 3 (Misd BJ)>>NO CONTEST
15CM1958 - Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on each count; 2 years probation on each count, concurrent to each other.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety; N/C with Wal-Mart in Marshfield; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must perform 10 hours of community service per week; CC; One DNA sample and surcharges.

>>State notes no restitution requested.
>>Defendant may transfer Probation to WOOD COUNTY

Adj: 9:43am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2012 and 15CM1958 called: 10:52am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant does NOT appear - Atty Jackan appears on behalf of Atty Mort.
(Originally set for TPD)

State notes receipt of email from Atty Suzanne O'Neill from PDs office that defendant not available for court today as is hospitalized.
Atty Jackan notes that information is correct.

COURT directs that cases be reset - JA to contact counsel to reset.
Bond continues.

Adj: 10:53am

INCLUDES 15CM1958 & 15CM2012   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  No contact with victim(s): Walmart-Marshfield. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
